bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, May 11, 1940

div1.p: Kean discusses an upcoming meeting with Hench and the honoring of Moran and Kissinger by the Cuban government.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, May 11, 1940

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Saturday
May 11th 1940

div1.p:
Your very pleasant letter
came the day before yesterday
and I should have answered it
by return mail in order to be
sure you would get it before you
left Rochester- But I spent yester-
day in bed with a heart attack
and so this will have to take the
chance- I shall be much pleased
to see you where you arrive on the
14 or 15, or an any time and hope
that I will be able to give you some
information which may be of use
to you- I will also write to Mr
Clemons to let you have photostats of
AC
K
2
the letters to which you refer-
I may have copies of them here
to show you that may make it
unnecessary to call on him-

I have just received an air mail
letter from Mr. Moran in Havana
saying that the Cuban Government
will give him and Kissinger decora-
tions of the Order de Carlos Finlay
at the Cuban Embassy, at a reception
to the Congress of Scientists on May
15, so you will probably meet him
there on that occasion, which will
be fine-

I am looking forward with much
pleasure to seeing you- The hotels
are very crowded here now and I
think you may find it more agree-
able to take a room at the Army
3-
Army and Navy Club, 17th and I Sts.,
n. w. If so you will find a card for
you at the desk which the clerk
will give you on application-

It might be well to phone and
ask the clerk at the desk if a room
is available- National 8400
